body:
Hi Mostapha



I am trying to run Daylight simulation with Dynamic blinds and I face something strange.

The point is that I see the effect of blinds on the illuminance values but the blind behavior file always shows NO BLINDS, How is it possible?



Best

Ata

replies.body: No blind just means that Daysim has picked the 'no blind' options based on your input thresholds. If you check an hour that lighting levels are more than expected then daysim will assume the blinds will be down.

But the question is that, if daysim takes 'no blind' option then how the illuminance values can be lower, I mean if there is no blind, the values should be the same with base case. Please correct me if I am wrong
